values.comments:
Chem054 is a continuation of Chem053, which is a general laboratory course covering aspects of qualitative and quantitative analysis, determination of chemical and physical properties, and chemical synthesis.

While some students did appreciate the course, many felt that it was irrelevant and that some topics went “outside the scope of the course.” The class was “frustrating and not fun.” One student said that this course “borderline discouraged [him] from pursuing a chemistry major.” 

Some students thought that Professor Maeyer tried hard and was “great” and “wonderful”; however, many thought that she was “disorganized” and “mediocre.” Some students felt that she did not adequately prepare for class, but many wrote that she was available outside of class to provide help.

The course load was considered too much for only a half credit, and some thought that the exams (practicals) were very difficult.
